title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0076

segments.en: Welcome back to another lesson with us here at EnglishPod.
And today we're going back to school.
That's right, we're talking about my least favorite subject.
segments.cn: 没错，我们要谈论我最不喜欢的科目。

segments.en: Okay, so we're going to be talking about math.
Now, I know that many of you, of course, know math.
segments.cn: 现在，我知道你们中的许多人当然会数学。

segments.en: But do you know the operations in English?
segments.cn: 但你们知道用英语怎么说这些运算吗？

segments.en: Many people find it hard to find the right words to talk about math in English.
segments.cn: 很多人发现用英语谈论数学时很难找到合适的词。

segments.en: So that's what we're going to be looking at today.
segments.cn: 所以这就是我们今天要看的内容。

segments.en: And we'll also look at some names that you can call people who are really, really, really smart.
segments.cn: 我们还会看看一些可以称呼非常聪明的人的名字。

segments.en: So let's listen to our dialogue for the first time.
And then we'll come back and look at those math words.
segments.cn: 然后我们再回来看看那些数学词。
好吧，孩子们，让我们复习一下。

segments.en: Okay, Crystal, now tell me, what's four plus 11?
segments.cn: 好的，Crystal，现在告诉我，四加11等于多少？

segments.en: Okay, smarty pants, the square root of two.
segments.cn: 好吧，聪明鬼，二的平方根。

segments.en: Bet you're not going to get that one.
segments.cn: 我打赌你不会得到那个。

segments.en: All right, so that's one smart little girl, huh?
segments.cn: 好吧，这真是个聪明的小女孩，嗯？

segments.en: All right, so let's take a look at some of those words that the teacher used to ask her about certain operations in language takeaway.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们看看老师用来询问某些运算的词汇。

segments.en: Okay, so like we said, you guys know how to do math and you know the words in your language, but maybe in English it's a little bit harder to find the right word.
segments.cn: 好吧，正如我们所说，你们知道如何做数学，也知道自己语言中的词，但在英语中可能更难找到合适的词。

segments.en: So let's look at those now.
segments.cn: 那么我们现在来看看这些。

segments.en: Okay, so let's look at the first question that she asked.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们看看她问的第一个问题。

segments.en: All right, so four plus 11, Erica, is?
Uh, let me take a look at here.
Okay, so we are adding, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，所以我们在加，对吗？

segments.en: So that's how you would say.
Let's go with an easy one.
Okay, you're really testing my skills.
segments.cn: 好吧，你真的在考验我的技能。

segments.en: So that's how you would add numbers.
segments.cn: 所以这就是你加数字的方式。

segments.en: Now what about taking away numbers?
Okay, so taking away or subtracting.
All right, let's test you again.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们再测试你一次。

segments.en: In the dialogue she said 56 minus 60.
So, and of course if you have 56 apples and you take away 60, you are left with negative four.
segments.cn: 所以，当然，如果你有56个苹果，减去60，你就剩下负四。

segments.en: Well, actually you're left with zero apples.
segments.cn: 实际上你剩下零个苹果。

segments.en: Now that answer is also interesting.
segments.cn: 现在那个答案也很有趣。

segments.en: Okay, so now for our next operation.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在是我们的下一个运算。

segments.en: Now Marco, don't ask me the answer.
Okay, so this times part, it's very easy to remember because, for example, four times four.
segments.cn: 好吧，这个乘法部分很容易记，因为，例如，四乘四。

segments.en: You can just say four, the number four, and you add it, right?
segments.cn: 你可以直接说四，数字四，然后加起来，对吧？

segments.en: Four plus four plus four plus four.
All right, the opposite of multiplication is division.
segments.cn: 好的，乘法的相反是除法。

segments.en: Okay, so in our dialogue, the teacher said zero divided by one.
segments.cn: 好的，在我们的对话中，老师说零除以一。

segments.en: Any number divided by zero is zero.
All right, so let's give another example.
segments.cn: 好的，我们再举一个例子。

segments.en: All right, so 15 divided by three equals five.
So after division, the teacher was very impressed, and now she asked a very hard mathematical operation, especially for a girl this age.
segments.cn: 所以在除法之后，老师非常印象深刻，现在她问了一个非常难的数学运算，尤其是对这个年龄的女孩来说。

segments.en: So let's give some examples to show what is the square root.
segments.cn: 所以我们来举一些例子，展示什么是平方根。

segments.en: Okay, so if I ask you the square root of nine.
segments.cn: 好的，如果我问你九的平方根。

segments.en: What about the square root of four?
Okay, so you notice the pattern, right?
segments.cn: 好的，你注意到这个模式了，对吧？

segments.en: And I'm sure everyone knows this in their own language, how you would get a square root.
segments.cn: 我相信每个人都知道自己语言中的平方根是怎么得来的。

segments.en: So this language is pretty simple.
segments.cn: 所以这个语言非常简单。

segments.en: You all know it in your own language, but let's hear it again in English one more time with the dialogue.
segments.cn: 你们都知道自己语言中的内容，但我们再用英语听一遍对话。
好的，孩子们，让我们复习一下。

segments.en: Okay, Crystal, now tell me, what's four plus 11?
segments.cn: 好的，水晶，现在告诉我，四加11等于多少？
卡迪拉克小姐总是问水晶。

segments.en: Okay, smarty pants, the square root of two.
segments.cn: 好的，聪明鬼，二的平方根。

segments.en: Bet you're not going to get that one.
segments.cn: 我打赌你不会得到那个。

segments.en: Okay, so we understand the mathematical operations that we saw here.
segments.cn: 好的，所以我们理解了这里看到的数学运算。

segments.en: But now there was another little kid in there who was very, I think, envious or jealous.
segments.cn: 但现在还有另一个小孩在那儿，他非常，我认为，是嫉妒。

segments.en: So he called her a couple of different names.
segments.cn: 所以他叫了她几个不同的名字。

segments.en: Well, let's look at those now in Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们现在在流利构建器中看看这些。

segments.en: Okay, so the first one that he called Crystal, the little girl, he called her a teacher's pet.
segments.cn: 好的，他叫水晶，小女孩，叫她老师的宠儿。

segments.en: So Erica, what exactly is a teacher's pet?
segments.cn: 所以埃里卡，老师的宠儿到底是什么？

segments.en: It is the favorite student the teacher has in that class.
segments.cn: 是老师在班上最喜欢的学生。

segments.en: All right, so it's always the student that's helping the teacher.
segments.cn: 好的，所以总是那个帮助老师的学生。

segments.en: Yeah, and it has a negative meaning in English.
segments.cn: 是的，在英语中有负面含义。

segments.en: Yeah, I wouldn't say that it's a good thing to be the teacher's pet.
segments.cn: 是的，我不会说成为老师的宠儿是一件好事。

segments.en: Like, the teacher thinks it's good, but all of the friends and the classmates, they think it's bad.
segments.cn: 就像，老师觉得这很好，但所有的朋友和同学都觉得这不好。

segments.en: And similar to teacher's pet is a suck-up.
segments.cn: 和老师的宠儿类似的是讨好。

segments.en: Again, suck-up, what is a suck-up?
A suck-up is a person who tries really, really hard to make the teacher like him.
segments.cn: 讨好是一个非常努力让老师喜欢他的人。

segments.en: Okay, now we can also use it outside of the classroom, right?
segments.cn: 好的，我们也可以在课堂外使用它，对吧？

segments.en: Okay, there is always at work, there is always one person who's the suck-up, right?
segments.cn: 好的，工作中总是有一个人是讨好的，对吧？

segments.en: Now, again, this has a negative meaning in English.
segments.cn: 现在，这在英语中也有负面含义。

segments.en: Yeah, I guess in the workplace the rest of your colleagues don't really like that person who's considered to be the suck-up, who's always trying to please the boss.
segments.cn: 是的，我想在工作场所，其他同事并不喜欢那个被认为是讨好的，总是试图取悦老板的人。

segments.en: All right, so the teacher calls Crystal a smarty-pants.
segments.cn: 好的，所以老师叫水晶聪明鬼。

segments.en: Okay, so this is also a little name calling, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，这也是一种小名叫，对吧？

segments.en: Who tries too hard to be smart.
Now, this is only for little kids, right?
segments.cn: 现在，这只是针对小孩子，对吧？

segments.en: I wouldn't call you a smarty-pants.

segments.cn: 不，这绝对是给孩子们的。

segments.en: Unless maybe you are joking or having fun with someone.
segments.cn: 除非你是在开玩笑或和某人玩乐。

segments.en: Yeah, but if you say it, you are suggesting that you're being like a child.
segments.cn: 是的，但如果你这么说，你是在暗示你像个孩子。

segments.en: And our last one, and this is also a very good phrase and a way to describe someone, know-it-all.
segments.cn: 我们最后一个，这也是一个很好的短语，用来形容某人，万事通。

segments.en: Sometimes you say Mr. Know-it-all, right?
segments.cn: 有时你会说万事通先生，对吧？

segments.en: Okay, so what is a know-it-all?
Somebody who tries to show everyone that they know it all.
segments.cn: 就是一个试图向每个人展示他们无所不知的人。

segments.en: They have the answers to everything.
But they really, really try and show everyone that they know everything.
segments.cn: 但他们真的很努力地向每个人展示他们知道一切。

segments.en: These people can be sometimes a little bit irritating, right?
segments.cn: 这些人有时会让人有点恼火，对吧？

segments.en: Alright, so it's not a good thing to be a know-it-all all the time.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以总是做一个万事通并不是好事。

segments.en: Yeah, actually all of these phrases are not good things to be.
segments.cn: 是的，实际上所有这些短语都不是好事。

segments.en: Okay, so let's listen to our dialogue one more time and then we're gonna come back and Eric is gonna tell us how much she hates math.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们再听一遍对话，然后我们会回来，埃里克会告诉我们她有多讨厌数学。
好吧，孩子们，让我们复习一下。
卡迪拉克小姐总是有克里斯塔尔。

segments.en: Bet you're not going to get that one do-it-all.
segments.cn: 我打赌你不会得到那个万事通。

segments.en: Alright, so Erica, you were telling me that you hated math, or you still do.
segments.cn: 好吧，埃里卡，你告诉我你讨厌数学，或者你仍然讨厌。

segments.en: I really do hate math and even doing a simple, you know, like 16 plus 32 is too hard for me.
segments.cn: 我真的讨厌数学，甚至像16加32这样简单的题对我来说也太难了。

segments.en: So you were never really that type of person that's good with numbers.
segments.cn: 所以你从来不是那种擅长数字的人。

segments.en: I can't even remember my own phone number.
segments.cn: 我甚至记不住自己的电话号码。

segments.en: Like, I really, if someone asks me for my phone number, I have to look on my phone in the address book to find it.
segments.cn: 就是说，如果有人问我电话号码，我必须在手机的通讯录里找。

segments.en: Well, yeah, sometimes numbers can be difficult.
segments.cn: 嗯，是的，有时数字确实很难。

segments.en: I kind of liked math when I was younger.
segments.cn: 我年轻时有点喜欢数学。

segments.en: Well, I guess there's a reason why I'm an English teacher, not a math teacher.
segments.cn: 嗯，我想我成为英语老师是有原因的，而不是数学老师。

segments.en: And I was actually not very good at language.
segments.cn: 而且我实际上在语言方面并不是很好。

segments.en: Well, I mean, in Spanish, I like grammar.
segments.cn: 嗯，我的意思是，在西班牙语中，我喜欢语法。

segments.en: I'm not very good at that, all those rules.
segments.cn: 我对那些规则并不太擅长。

segments.en: Yeah, but you're pretty good at English.
segments.cn: 是的，但你在英语方面相当不错。

segments.en: Tell us what your favorite subject or your least favorite subject in school was.
segments.cn: 告诉我们你们在学校最喜欢或最不喜欢的科目是什么。

segments.en: Do you have any favorite subject or did you have a favorite subject?
segments.cn: 你有最喜欢的科目吗，或者你曾经有过最喜欢的科目吗？

segments.en: I liked chemistry for a while.
Well, a little bit, but it was interesting as well.
segments.cn: 嗯，稍微有点，但也很有趣。

segments.en: So come to the website, everyone, EnglishPod.com, and you can find lots of other resources there.
segments.cn: 所以大家来网站，EnglishPod.com，你可以找到很多其他资源。

segments.en: And also be sure to check out our activity stream where you can answer and ask very quick questions depending on your level.
segments.cn: 还要确保查看我们的活动流，你可以根据你的水平回答和提问非常快速的问题。

segments.en: So you can choose if you're an elementary student, then you would be talking to other elementaries.
segments.cn: 所以如果你是小学生，你就可以和其他小学生交流。

segments.en: Well, thanks for downloading this lesson.
segments.cn: 好吧，感谢你下载这节课。
